text: This is a list of the 6 members of the European Parliament for Luxembourg in the 2004 to 2009 session. ==List== {| class="sortable wikitable" |- ! Name !! National party !! EP Group !! Votes |- | Robert GoebbelsReplaced Jean Asselborn (14,461 votes), who remained Deputy Prime Minister and the Minister for Foreign Affairs and Immigration in Juncker III. | Socialist Workers' Party | PES | 12,169 |- | Erna Hennicot-SchoepgesReplaced François Biltgen (16,929 votes), who remained Minister of Justice, Civil Service & Administrative Reform, Higher Education & Research, Communications & Media and Religious Affairs in Juncker III. | Christian Social People's Party | EPP–ED | 7,453 |- | Astrid LullingReplaced Jean-Claude Juncker (41,535 votes), who remained Prime Minister. | Christian Social People's Party | EPP–ED | 12,809 |- | Lydie Polfer | Democratic Party | ALDE | 22,179 |- | Jean SpautzReplaced Luc Frieden (25,228 votes), who remained Minister for Finance in Juncker III. | Christian Social People's Party | EPP–ED | 12,302 |- | Claude Turmes | The Greens | G–EFA | 13,828 |} ===Party representation=== {| class="wikitable" |- ! National party !! EP Group !!
